attack-object.name: Gather Victim Network Information
attack-object.score-comment: This control can prevent the gathering of victim network information via scanning methods but is not effective against methods such as Phishing resulting in a Partial coverage score and an overall Partial score.

attack-object.name: Active Scanning
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides Partial protection for its sub-techniques resulting in an overall Partial score.

attack-object.name: External Remote Services
attack-object.score-comment: This control can limit access to external remote services to the minimum necessary.

attack-object.name: Traffic Signaling
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides partial protection for this technique's sub-techniques and procedure examples resulting in a Partial score.

attack-object.name: Network Service Scanning
attack-object.score-comment: This control typically filters external network traffic and therefore can be effective for preventing external network service scanning but network service scanning originating from inside the trusted network is not mitigated.  Due to this partial protection coverage, it has been scored as Partial protection.

attack-object.name: Remote System Discovery
attack-object.score-comment: This control typically filters external network traffic and therefore can be effective for preventing external remote system discovery but such activity originating from inside the trusted network is not mitigated.  Due to this partial protection coverage, it has been scored as Partial protection.

attack-object.name: Fallback Channels
attack-object.score-comment: This control's threat intelligence-based filtering feature can be enabled to alert and deny traffic from/to known malicious IP addresses and domains. The IP addresses and domains are sourced from the Microsoft Threat Intelligence feed.  Because this protection is limited to known malicious IP addresses and domains and does not provide protection from such attacks from unknown domains and IP addresses, this is scored as partial coverage resulting in an overall Partial score.

attack-object.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
attack-object.score-comment:
This control's threat intelligence-based filtering feature can be enabled to alert and deny traffic from/to known malicious IP addresses and domains. The IP addresses and domains are sourced from the Microsoft Threat Intelligence feed.  Because this protection is limited to known malicious IP addresses and domains and does not provide protection from such attacks from unknown domains and IP addresses, this is scored as partial coverage resulting in an overall Partial score.
Furthermore, it can be used to filter non-application layer protocol traffic such as ICMP.

attack-object.name: Non-Standard Port
attack-object.score-comment: This control can limit access to the minimum required ports and therefore protect against adversaries attempting to use non-standard ports for C2 traffic.

attack-object.name: Remote Access Software
attack-object.score-comment: This control can be used to limit outgoing traffic to only sites and services used by authorized remote access tools.  This is scored as partial because it doesn't protect against an adversary using an authorized remote access tool for malicious activity.

attack-object.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
attack-object.score-comment: This control provides partial protection for this technique's sub-techniques and some of its procedure examples resulting in an overall Partial score.
